name: axc11v
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, wff w0
body: |- wi(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wi(wal(s0, w0), wal(s1, w0)))

stmt.origin: spsd(s0, wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), w0, wal(s1, w0))

body.origin:
|- wi(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wi(wal(s0, w0), wal(s1, w0)))
-| wi(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wi(w0, wal(s1, w0)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wi(wal(s0, w0), wal(s1, w0)))
-| wi(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wi(w0, wal(s1, w0)))

body.origin:
|- wi(wal(s0, wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1))), wi(w0, wal(s1, w0)))

comment: Version of ~ axc11 with a disjoint variable condition on ` x ` and ` y ` , which is provable, on top of { ~ ax-1 -- ~ ax-7 }, from ~ ax12v (contrary to ~ axc11 which seems to require the full ~ ax-12 and ~ ax-13 ). (Contributed by BJ, 6-Jul-2021.) (Proof shortened by Wolf Lammen, 11-Oct-2021.)
